meanings.definition: A loud, enthusiastic shout or exclamation.
meanings.sent1: The crowd let out a whoot of joy when the team scored a goal.
meanings.sent2: I heard a whoot of excitement coming from the concert hall.
meanings.sent3: The whoot of the fans could be heard all the way down the street.
meanings.sent4: Her whoot of surprise echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The whoot of the fireworks filled the night sky with celebration.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, enthusiastic shout or exclamation.
meanings.sent1: He loves to whoot with excitement when he sees his friends.
meanings.sent2: The fans whoot loudly to show their support for the team.
meanings.sent3: I whoot every time I see a cute puppy on the street.
meanings.sent4: She whooted with joy when she won the race.
meanings.sent5: The children whooted with glee as they played in the park.
